body:
here is the command line I used to build the helloworld example in the original git repo:

```
CL.exe /I..\..\..\third_party\protobuf\src /I..\..\..\include /D _WIN32_WINNT=0x0600 /D _SCL_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS /D NDEBUG /EHsc /MT /GL greeter_server.cc helloworld.grpc.pb.cc helloworld.pb.cc /link /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/Release" /libpath:"../../../third_party/protobuf/cmake/Release" /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/packages/grpc.dependencies.zlib.1.2.8.10/build/native/lib/v120/Win32/Release/static/cdecl" /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/packages/grpc.dependencies.openssl.1.0.204.1/build/native/lib/v120/Win32/Release/static" libprotobuf.lib gpr.lib grpc.lib grpc++.lib ws2_32.lib zlib.lib libeay32.lib ssleay32.lib user32.lib gdi32.lib advapi32.lib /out:greeter_server.exe

CL.exe /I..\..\..\third_party\protobuf\src /I..\..\..\include /D _WIN32_WINNT=0x0600 /D _SCL_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS /D NDEBUG /EHsc /MT /GL greeter_client.cc helloworld.grpc.pb.cc helloworld.pb.cc /link /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/Release" /libpath:"../../../third_party/protobuf/cmake/Release" /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/packages/grpc.dependencies.zlib.1.2.8.10/build/native/lib/v120/Win32/Release/static/cdecl" /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/packages/grpc.dependencies.openssl.1.0.204.1/build/native/lib/v120/Win32/Release/static" libprotobuf.lib gpr.lib grpc.lib grpc++.lib ws2_32.lib zlib.lib libeay32.lib ssleay32.lib user32.lib gdi32.lib advapi32.lib /out:greeter_client.exe
```

Then I started the greeter_server.exe and greeter_client.exe:

```
D:\git\grpc\examples\cpp\helloworld>start greeter_server.exe

D:\git\grpc\examples\cpp\helloworld>greeter_client.exe
Greeter received: Hello world
D1216 15:57:00.529000000 14368 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D1216 15:57:01.609000000 14368 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D1216 15:57:02.703000000 14368 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D1216 15:57:03.797000000 14368 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D1216 15:57:04.891000000 14368 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D1216 15:57:05.984000000 14368 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D1216 15:57:07.078000000 14368 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D1216 15:57:08.172000000 14368 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D1216 15:57:09.257000000 14368 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D1216 15:57:09.482000000 14368 iomgr.c:114] Failed to free 1 iomgr objects before shutdown deadline: memory leaks are likely
D1216 15:57:09.482000000 14368 iomgr.c:77] LEAKED OBJECT: client:socket=0x00CD7468 00CD74E0
D1216 15:57:09.482000000 14368 metadata.c:228] WARNING: 1 metadata elements were leaked
D1216 15:57:09.482000000 14368 metadata.c:228] WARNING: 1 metadata elements were leaked
D1216 15:57:09.482000000 14368 metadata.c:228] WARNING: 1 metadata elements were leaked
D1216 15:57:09.482000000 14368 metadata.c:238] WARNING: 1 metadata strings were leaked
D1216 15:57:09.482000000 14368 metadata.c:238] WARNING: 1 metadata strings were leaked
D1216 15:57:09.482000000 14368 metadata.c:238] WARNING: 1 metadata strings were leaked

D:\git\grpc\examples\cpp\helloworld>
```

And I can reproduce this issue every time on several different machines.

I can confirm I've seen this. I hope to look at it in the next few days.

Any progress on this bug? I'm getting the same thing after compiling the same commands line on VS2013 as goldenbull.

@ctiller
@ctiller , any chance someone from C core could take a look at this?

### update

steps to reproduce:
(1) Windows 10, Visual Studio 2015, master branch 17ddc83b33da0befa0d9f7395b04ea3ecaff6854
(2) remove `BoringSSL` and `z` from `grpc.sln`
(3) run `cmake`, `nuget restore` and `msbuild` to build `protobuf.sln`, `grpc_protoc_plugins.sln` and `grpc.sln`
(4) in `examples` folder, generate `helloworld.*.h/cpp` from `helloworld.proto`
(5) build cpp examples using command line:

```
CL.exe /I..\..\..\third_party\protobuf\src /I..\..\..\include /D _WIN32_WINNT=0x0600 /D _SCL_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS /D NDEBUG /EHsc /MT /GL greeter_server.cc helloworld.grpc.pb.cc helloworld.pb.cc /link /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/Release" /libpath:"../../../third_party/protobuf/cmake/Release" /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/packages/grpc.dependencies.zlib.1.2.8.10/build/native/lib/v140/Win32/Release/static/cdecl" /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/packages/grpc.dependencies.openssl.1.0.204.1/build/native/lib/v140/Win32/Release/static" libprotobuf.lib gpr.lib grpc.lib grpc++.lib ws2_32.lib zlib.lib libeay32.lib ssleay32.lib user32.lib gdi32.lib advapi32.lib /out:greeter_server.exe
CL.exe /I..\..\..\third_party\protobuf\src /I..\..\..\include /D _WIN32_WINNT=0x0600 /D _SCL_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS /D NDEBUG /EHsc /MT /GL greeter_client.cc helloworld.grpc.pb.cc helloworld.pb.cc /link /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/Release" /libpath:"../../../third_party/protobuf/cmake/Release" /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/packages/grpc.dependencies.zlib.1.2.8.10/build/native/lib/v140/Win32/Release/static/cdecl" /libpath:"../../../vsprojects/packages/grpc.dependencies.openssl.1.0.204.1/build/native/lib/v140/Win32/Release/static" libprotobuf.lib gpr.lib grpc.lib grpc++.lib ws2_32.lib zlib.lib libeay32.lib ssleay32.lib user32.lib gdi32.lib advapi32.lib /out:greeter_client.exe
```

(6) run `greeter_server.exe` then `greeter_client.exe`, the client will report memory leak on exit

```
D:\git\grpc\examples\cpp\helloworld>greeter_client.exe
Greeter received: Hello world
D0220 11:51:37.447000000  7740 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:51:38.480000000  7740 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:51:39.485000000  7740 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:51:40.490000000  7740 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:51:41.590000000  7740 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:51:42.623000000  7740 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:51:43.626000000  7740 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:51:44.645000000  7740 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:51:45.678000000  7740 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:51:46.481000000  7740 iomgr.c:114] Failed to free 1 iomgr objects before shutdown deadline: memory leaks are likely
D0220 11:51:46.483000000  7740 iomgr.c:77] LEAKED OBJECT: client:socket=0x01097628 010976A0
D0220 11:51:46.490000000  7740 metadata.c:228] WARNING: 1 metadata elements were leaked
D0220 11:51:46.495000000  7740 metadata.c:228] WARNING: 1 metadata elements were leaked
D0220 11:51:46.501000000  7740 metadata.c:228] WARNING: 1 metadata elements were leaked
D0220 11:51:46.507000000  7740 metadata.c:238] WARNING: 1 metadata strings were leaked
D0220 11:51:46.513000000  7740 metadata.c:238] WARNING: 1 metadata strings were leaked
D0220 11:51:46.518000000  7740 metadata.c:238] WARNING: 1 metadata strings were leaked
```

(7) modify `greeter_server.cc`, call `server->Shutdown()` instead of `server->Wait()`, then server will also report memory leak on exit.

```
D:\git\grpc\examples\cpp\helloworld>greeter_server.exe
Server listening on 0.0.0.0:50051
D0220 11:39:46.128000000  6728 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:39:47.147000000  6728 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:39:48.165000000  6728 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:39:49.172000000  6728 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:39:50.192000000  6728 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:39:51.195000000  6728 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:39:52.213000000  6728 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:39:53.232000000  6728 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:39:54.250000000  6728 iomgr.c:96] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed
D0220 11:39:55.168000000  6728 iomgr.c:114] Failed to free 1 iomgr objects before shutdown deadline: memory leaks are likely
D0220 11:39:55.169000000  6728 iomgr.c:77] LEAKED OBJECT: listener:socket=0x006635E0 00663658
```
I think I saw things under linux similar to this one. I will look over there and hopefully it is the same problem.
hi @yang-g any progress of this issue? It's the last observed obstacle to use grpc in real world application now :sob:
@ctiller  hopefully we will be address this during this week's fixit.

@goldenbull The linux issue is different from this one and I believe this is a windows specific problem. I started to reproduce it on a windows VM over the weekend. I will keep working on it and keep this thread updated. Thanks.
@goldenbull I was able to reproduce the problem on a GCE windows VM and sent out a fix. Could you try #5545 to see whether that fixes the problems for you? Thanks.

For one time connect-request-response-disconnect routine, your patch works fine. But when I put this routine in an infinite loop, there is something wrong:

```
E0303 10:39:25.206000000 17772 tcp_client_windows.c:106] on_connect error: Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted.

E0303 10:39:25.217000000 17760 tcp_client_windows.c:106] on_connect error: Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted.

E0303 10:39:33.888000000  5832 tcp_client_windows.c:106] on_connect error: Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted.

E0303 10:39:33.890000000  5832 tcp_client_windows.c:106] on_connect error: Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted.

E0303 10:39:40.537000000  5832 tcp_client_windows.c:106] on_connect error: Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted.

E0303 10:39:40.539000000  5832 tcp_client_windows.c:106] on_connect error: Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted.

E0303 10:39:52.914000000  5832 tcp_client_windows.c:106] on_connect error: Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted.

E0303 10:39:52.915000000  5832 tcp_client_windows.c:106] on_connect error: Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted.
```

Using the command `netstat -an` I see a lot of connections in `TIME_WAIT` status:

```
  TCP    127.0.0.1:62589        127.0.0.1:50051        TIME_WAIT
  TCP    127.0.0.1:62591        127.0.0.1:50051        TIME_WAIT
```

Thanks for confirming the fix. I am not sure how you put things in a loop but it seems you exhausted ports. Maybe you put everything including the channel creation in the loop? I think you can try something like `auto channel = CreateChannel();` then put the rest into a loop or just do a `while (true)  greeter.SayHello();`

Yes, I know how to keep all sessions on one channel but I meant to do the
connection pressure test :)
TIME_WAIT problem is a common issue when one peer doesn't close the socket
gracefully, so I think there is still a bug somewhere

2016-03-03 15:00 GMT+08:00 Yang Gao notifications@github.com:

> Thanks for confirming the fix. I am not sure how you put things in a loop
> but it seems you exhausted ports. Maybe you put everything including the
> channel creation in the loop? I think you can try something like auto
> channel = CreateChannel(); then put the rest into a loop or just do a while
> (true) greeter.SayHello();
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/4443#issuecomment-191616939.
Please file another issue for that. Thanks.
